attributes.action: impose import duties on produce whos workers do not receive a working wage.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Fair Trade movement will always be at a disadvantage compared to products made in near slave labour conditions, as economics dictate that fairly traded goods will be more expensive.

Britain should make a stand against these practises by:

* imposing import duties on products manufactured under near slave labour conditions,

* giving the duty collected to the communities who manufactured the products, to allow those communities to develop as if they were paid a fair wage.

Products manufactured under fair conditions would be exempt. Naturally, the definition of "fair" would need careful consideration, as would inspection regimes.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
